1.text: Remember, O Lord, what is come upon us: consider and behold our reproach.

2.text: Our inheritance is turned to aliens: our houses to strangers.

3.text: We are become orphans without a father: our mothers are as widows.

4.text: We have drunk our water for money: we have bought our wood.

5.text: We were dragged by the necks, we were weary and no rest was given us.

6.text: We have given our hand to Egypt, and to the Assyrians, that we might be satisfied with bread.

7.text: Our fathers have sinned, and are not: and we have borne their iniquities.

8.text: Servants have ruled over us: there was none to redeem us out of their hand.

9.text: We fetched our bread at the peril of our lives, because of the sword in the desert.

10.text: Our skin was burnt as an oven, by reason of the violence of the famine.

11.text: They oppressed the women in Sion, and the virgins in the cities of Juda.

12.text: The princes were hanged up by their hand: they did not respect the persons of the ancient.

13.text: They abused the young men indecently: and the children fell under the wood.

14.text: The ancients have ceased from the gates: the young men from the choir of the singers.

15.text: The joy of our heart is ceased, our dancing is turned into mourning.

16.text: The crown is fallen from our head woe to us, because we have sinned.

17.text: Therefore is our heart sorrowful, therefore are our eyes become dim,

18.text: For mount Sion, because it is destroyed, foxes have walked upon it.

19.text: But thou, O Lord, shalt remain for ever, thy throne from generation to generation.

20.text: Why wilt thou forget us for ever? why wilt thou forsake us for a long time?

21.text: Convert us, O Lord, to thee, and we shall be converted: renew our days, as from the beginning.

22.text: But thou hast utterly rejected us, thou art exceedingly angry against us.
